alert.note: Alert for Greene (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 25 at 3:41PM CDT until August 25 at 4:45PM CDT by NWS Mobile
info.description: The National Weather Service in Mobile has extended the * Flash Flood Warning for... Southwestern Washington County in southwestern Alabama... Northern Greene County in southeastern Mississippi... * Until 445 PM CDT. * At 341 PM CDT, Doppler radar continued to indicate moderate to locally heavy rainfall continuing in northern Greene county. Greene County Emergency Management recently reported water over the roadway near the intersection of George Williams Road, Percyvale Jones Road, and Indian Hill Road in northern Greene county. Additional rainfall will aggravate ongoing flash flooding in the warned area. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... State Line, Fruitdale, Clark, Old Avera, Knobtown, Jonathan, Yellow Pine, Escatawpa, Four Point, Burbank, Avera, Bothwell, Piave, Vinegar Bend, Byrd and Sand Hill. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
